From Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia


2022 Indian Hindi-language film


TrahimamOfficial Poster of TrahimamDirected byDushyant Pratap SinghProduced byFaheem R. QureshiNeetu TiwariSumendra TiwariStarringArshi KhanPankaj BerryMushtaq KhanCinematographySuhas RaoEdited bySunil YadavAnil YadavMusic byPiyush RanjanDistributed byDushyant Pratap SinghRelease date
16 December 2022 (2022-12-16)
CountryIndiaLanguageHindi
Trahimam  is an upcoming Indian Hindi-language drama film directed by Dushyant Pratap Singh. The film stars Arshi Khan, Pankaj Berry, Mushtaq Khan and Adi Irani.[1][2] The trailer of the film was released on November 1, 2022.[3]


Cast[edit]
Arshi Khan[citation needed]
Pankaj Berry[4]
Adi Irani[5]
Mushtaq Khan
Raju Kher
Ekta Jain[6]
Plot[edit]
The film revolves around village girl named Champa, played by Arshi Khan.[7] It is shown in the movie how she was raped and political powers escape rapist and all the criminals.[8]

Soundtrack[edit]
TrahimamSoundtrack album by Piyush RanjanGenreFilm soundtrackLabelDushyant CorporationProducerFaheem R. QureshiNeetu TiwariSumendra Tiwari
The Music and background score were composed by Piyush Ranjan and the lyrics were penned by Manish Muradiya. 

All lyrics are written by Manish Muradiya; all music is composed by Piyush RanjanTrack ListingNo.TitleFeaturesLength1.UntitledArshi Khan 
Filming[edit]
The film is mostly shot in Mumbai, Maharashtra, Agra, Uttar Pradesh and mainly in Rajasthan.

References[edit]


^ The Times Of India (14 September 2021). "Bollywood was my dream and now that is coming true I am nervous, Arshi Khan on her Bollywood debut with Trahimam". www.timesofindia.indiatimes.com.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 14 September 2021.

^ Times Now Hindi (15 September 2021). "Bigg Boss fame Arshi Khan is set to debut in Bollywood with film Trahimam, Know about her role". www.timesnowhindi. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 15 September 2021.

^ Bollywood Hungama (2 November 2022). "Celebs grace the trailer launch of the film Trahimam". www.bollywoodhungama.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 26 November 2022.

^ Asianet News. "Trahimam is based on a true incident, strong acting of Arshi Khan and Pankaj Berry". www.asianetnews.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 3 November 2022.

^ ABP Live (14 September 2021). "Bigg Boss 14 Arshi Khan feels blessed to make her Bollywood debut". www.abplive.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 26 November 2022.

^ Times Of India (17 January 2022). "I have powerful roles in my upcoming films Trahimam and Shatranj, says actress Ekta Jain". www.timesofindia.indiatimes.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 26 November 2022.

^ KoiMoi. "Arshi Khan on big Bollywood debut, 'I'm literally not believing that it's happening". www.koimoi.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 26 November 2022.

^ India.com. "Director Dushyant Pratap Singh said boycott is not the reason, Bollywood needs good concepts". www.india.com. Archived from the original on 26 November 2022. Retrieved 26 November 2022.
